model

Class TermParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.TermParser

  • public class TermParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a variety of methods which can be used to parse a CafeOBJ term and store its contents in appropriate objects
    Author:
    nikos

      static void parseBasicExpr(java.lang.String exp, BasicTerm basic)
      Parses a basic CafeOBJ expresion, i,e, an operator with values either variables or constants an operator is thus basic if the arguments are not non-constant operators this is easily found if we recall the for that to occur there must exist parenthesis of [] in the operator string and stores the result to the given BasicOpExpr object

      • getInnerTerm

        public static java.lang.String getInnerTerm(java.lang.String term)
        Parameters:
        term -
        mainOp - the name of the main operator of the term
        pos - the position of the operator
        Returns:
        the inside part of the term (inner part of the main operator) if that exists otherwise the term as it is is returned

      • isBasicTerm

        public static boolean isBasicTerm(java.lang.String s)
        Takes an expression and determines if it contains an operator call or if it only contains constants or variables as arguments
        Returns:
        true if the string has no '(' or if inside the initial (...) there exist no other parenthesis or brackets

      • isTermConsOrVar

        public static boolean isTermConsOrVar(java.lang.String term)
        Parameters:
        term -
        Returns:
        whether or not the given term is a constant or a variable, i.e. contains no arguments

      • parseBasicExpr

        public static void parseBasicExpr(java.lang.String exp,
                                  BasicTerm basic)
        Parses a basic CafeOBJ expresion, i,e, an operator with values either variables or constants an operator is thus basic if the arguments are not non-constant operators this is easily found if we recall the for that to occur there must exist parenthesis of [] in the operator string and stores the result to the given BasicOpExpr object
        Parameters:
        exp -
        op -

      • getSubTermPos

        public static int getSubTermPos(java.lang.String term)
        takes as input a term and returns the ending position of the first subterm if no subterm exists -1 is returned
        Parameters:
        term -
        Returns:
        the ending position of a subterm or if none exists -1

      • getMainPos

        public static OpNamePos getMainPos(java.lang.String term)
        parses a term and returns an Object containing the position and name of the main Operator of the term
        Parameters:
        term -
        Returns:
        an Object containing the position and name of the main Operator if there exists no main operator -1 is returned as the position instead

      • splitTerm

        public static void splitTerm(java.lang.String term,
                             java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> args,
                             boolean makeSub)
        takes as input a term and gets its inner part of the main operator splits that into arguments and returns a vector containing those arguments i.e. f(a(b,c),g) --> [a(b,c) , g]
        Parameters:
        term -
        args - the vector in which the subterms are stored

      • parseSubTerm

        public static CafeTerm parseSubTerm(java.lang.String term)
        takes as input a term and returns a CafeTerm object which contains its parsing, i.e. operator and a vector of the arguments of the term
        Returns:

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> eqToTree(java.lang.String eqTerm)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        eqTerm - a String representing a equation
        Returns:
        a Vector (containing one or two Strings) representing the left and right part of the equation term
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getPositionOfSystemSort

        public static int getPositionOfSystemSort(CafeTerm t,
                                          Module mod)
        Parameters:
        t -
        Returns:
        the position of the system sort, i.e. the sort which is defined by the module in the term. If no such sort exists -1 is returned
